markdown: The [destination](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/keys/destination) key has continued to grow and they has surpassed the [exit_to](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/keys/exit_to) tags - at least in the US.

A new [website](http://taginfo.openstreetmap.it) of taginfo for 20 Italian regions has been set up. The data is based on extracts from [taginfo](http://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/) and are updated daily.

Jochen Topf [blogs](https://blog.jochentopf.com/2016-08-15-taginfo-projects.html) about the latest changes made to the [taginfo](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/projects) 'projects' feature, also encouraging users to add their projects to the page.

On the OSM-Talk mailing list, Matthijs Melissa [proposed](https://www.mail-archive.com/talk@openstreetmap.org/msg56316.html)  to replace the wiki page [Map Features](http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Map_Features) with an automatically generated version from Taginfo.
... the Taginfo report that [indicates](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/reports/frequently_used_keys_without_wiki_page) which tags are used a lot but do not have a wiki page to describe them?

![Example of wikipage containing the new Taginfo feature](http://www.weeklyosm.eu/wp-content/uploads/2016/11/man_made_331.png) Taginfo extended to show an example rendering in
the taglists on the OSM-wiki [^1^](#wn331_13532) | Screenshot from OSM-Wiki under [CC-BY-SA 2.0](https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0/de/)

[1] Jochen Topf [extends](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk/2016-November/077051.html) his Taginfo to display example renderings in the wiki's taglists. Matthijs Melissen [tested](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk/2016-November/077095.html) this for some pages. If you would like to help Matthijs, please [contact](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk/2016-November/077107.html) him directly.

On the tagging mailing list, Dave F [wonders](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/tagging/2017-May/032401.html)  about the existence of `toilets:wheelchair` and `wheelchair_toilet` in the iD editor. After some discussion, he gets the information that a pre-selection for free texts information comes from [Taginfo](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/) and thus can contain typos.

A new [Taginfo site for Japan](http://taginfo.openstreetmap.jp/) has been setup, joining the other 12 [country specific Taginfo sites](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Taginfo/Sites). The site is operated by [MIERUNE](http://www.mierune.co.jp/).

Marc Zoutendijk [asks](https://forum.openstreetmap.org/viewtopic.php?id=55541) ![(nl)](http://blog.openstreetmap.de/wp-uploads//2016/12/nl.svg) on the forum if over 10,000 different [`building= ` tag keys](http://mijndev.openstreetmap.nl/~marczoutendijk/taginfo-building.html) are really needed.
User ImreSamu has created [test instances of Taginfo](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/ImreSamu/diary/43540) and made them available online for testing and feedback.

Leo Gaspard would [like](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/tagging/2018-July/037803.html) the `landuse=highway` tag to be used more often as he wants road areas to be tagged along with their surfaces. However, as [noted](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/tagging/2018-July/037804.html) during the conversation, the [widely](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/search?q=area%3Ahighway) used  `area:highway= ` [includes](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Proposed_features/area:highway) an optional surface tag already.

All mappers use [taginfo](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/) at some time or another. Jochen Topf, the developer, [blogs](https://blog.jochentopf.com/2018-08-09-taginfo-localization.html) that the tool now supports 18 languages, after the addition of Farsi (فارسی / Persian) as the first right-to-left language. If you can help with translations, either by adding a new language or by completing an existing one, please have a look at this [wiki page](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Taginfo/I18N).
Imre Samu [shows](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/taginfo-dev/2018-August/000279.html) a proof of concept for a taginfo extension to enable filtering by area.

Simon Poole [announced](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/SimonPoole/diary/44879) the release of Vespucci 11.1 BETA. The newly implemented features include:
  improved preset handling
  lookup in taginfo now happens manually for the recently introduced "auto-presets"
  improved copy and paste of tags
  more minor changes.

... how to tag shops offering vegan, halal, kosher or gluten-free products? The [keys](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:diet) `diet:vegan`, `diet:halal`, `diet:kosher`, `diet:gluten_free` and several [more](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/search?q=diet%3A) can be added to mark them.

... how to tag the fuels available at a petrol station? It's recommended to use generic names for different types of fuel instead of local names or brands to keep the data consistent world-wide. The Wiki [documents](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:fuel) these values, but in total there are more than [500 different "fuel: " tags](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/search?q=fuel%3A) in use - most of them undocumented and used only a few times each.

Guillaume Rischard [reminds](https://github.com/taginfo/taginfo/pull/267) us to use http instead of https for connections to JOSM as https support [will probably be dropped](https://josm.openstreetmap.de/ticket/10033). He points to the World Wide Web Consortium [specifications](https://github.com/w3c/webappsec-mixed-content/commit/349501c) for trusted connections.

... [Taginfo](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/), the site which allows exploration of which keys and tags are in use on OSM. A number of [local versions](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Taginfo/Sites) exist too.

... that there are more than 1.5 million objects with a ["fixme"](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/search?q=fixme) tag? Maybe you can have a look and fix some in your vicinity? You can use [Overpass-Turbo](http://overpass-turbo.eu/s/BIR) to find them.

Christine Karch, of Geofabrik, [tweets](https://twitter.com/HermioneNight/status/1213850596589080576) about a new service developed by the company: [regional instances](https://taginfo.geofabrik.de/europe/germany/baden-wuerttemberg/) of taginfo. The urls follow the same pattern as on Geofabrik's download service.

The JOSM team has released stable version 20.02 (release 15915) of their OSM editor. The new version brings access to Maxar's imagery back, add links to Geofabrik's regional/national Taginfo instances, improves JOSM's Autofilters and has [many many more](https://josm.openstreetmap.de/wiki/Changelog#stable-release-20.02) new features and improvements.

Ça reste ouvert, the map of places open during the COVID-19 lockdown, has collected opening hours in France [for almost 20,000 places](https://taginfo.geofabrik.de/europe/france/keys/opening_hours%3Acovid19) within three weeks.

The French community collaborated with several other communities and has added new countries to the map: Germany, Switzerland and Austria (as ['Bleibt offen'](https://www.bleibtoffen.de/)), as well as Spain and Andorra. Their GitHub repository provides [an issue template](https://github.com/osmontrouge/caresteouvert/issues/new/choose) to request coverage for your country.

The French service provider TransWay has [published](https://apps.apple.com/app/ça-reste-ouvert/id1506199151) a mobile app for iOS. Eric Afenyo is [developing](https://github.com/osmontrouge/caresteouvert_android) one for Android.

Laura Bliss [writes](https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-07-29/the-pandemic-era-appeal-of-labyrinths) on _Bloomberg CityLab_ about the pandemic-era appeal of getting lost in a labyrinth, and links to the [world wide labyrinth locator](https://labyrinthlocator.com). On OpenStreetMap, the [`attraction=maze`](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Proposed_features/maze) tag is used [about 800 times](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/tags/attraction=maze).

... [Taginfo](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/), the site which allows you to explore the tags and values used in OSM? Several [local versions](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Taginfo/Sites) are available for you to explore at a country level.
Dongha Hwang (LuxuryCoop) has [created](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/LuxuryCoop/diary/394737) a [Taginfo](http://taginfo.openstreetmap.pe.kr/) instance for South Korea.
... Taginfo now [has](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/keys/access#chronology) a chronology tab? You can use it to see how often a tag has been used in the past.

Jochen Topf [gave](https://blog.jochentopf.com/2020-11-08-10-years-of-taginfo.html) an overview of the first ten years of Taginfo, a service developed and maintained by himself, and describes some of the recently added features.
... that Geofabrik [is hosting](https://rlin.eu/osm/geofabrik/) Taginfo instances for each country (plus some regions) and continent, even Antarctica?

Brian Sperlongano is [proposing](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Proposed_features/hazard) the key `hazard= ` to primarily map hazardous locations that have warning signs. The key has been in use [for many years](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/keys/hazard#chronology) with over 30,000 cases, but this proposal takes up an unfinished version from 2007 (by user Espen) and documents many examples in detail (for example, as we [reported](http://weeklyosm.eu/archives/14046/#wn542_23938) on, landslides).
... by using [the shortcuts of the DuckDuckGo search engine](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Search_engines#DuckDuckGo_shortcuts) you can perform searches directly in OSM, Taginfo, or the Wiki?

taginfo has had a facility since [2014](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/w/index.php?title=Taginfo/Projects&oldid=1080810) which allows specific individual projects to show which tags they consume. SomeoneElse [shows](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/SomeoneElse/diary/396724) how he generated suitable JSON for loading to taginfo from the Lua and Carto-CSS code behind his own maps for the UK and Ireland. The process was slightly simplified because all the tags used in Carto-CSS are also used in the Lua file, meaning that tags only needed to be extracted from one file.

French user Lejun has [mapped](https://twitter.com/OSM_BFC/status/1400076143873642499) ![(fr)](https://blog.openstreetmap.de/wp-uploads/2016/12/fr.svg), in his city, about a dozen vending machines for free menstrual products. While not being the first vending machines of their kind, they seem to be the first to be tagged so thoroughly in OpenStreetMap according to [taginfo](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/tags/?key=vending&value=feminine_hygiene).

User mahdi1234 [published](https://hackmd.io/sojtg6BcSCi1_LRjni7-Jw?view) a short article on building a Matrix chatbot to report statistics from taginfo in the Czech community channel #osmcz:matrix.org.

![lead picture](https://weeklyosm.eu/wp-content/uploads/sites/4/2021/10/584_T_KO.png =348x546)

Korea presents own website, own tile server, and a taginfo instance  [[^1^](#wn584_25637)] map data © [OpenStreetMap contributors](https://www.openstreetmap.org/copyright)

The new Korean OpenStreetMap Community [presented](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk-ko/2021-September/000566.html) their website, their own [tile server](https://tiles.osm.kr/), and a [Taginfo instance](https://taginfo.osm.kr/), summarising the Korean regional OpenStreetMap database, running on the [osm.kr](https://osm.kr/) ![(ko)](https://weeklyosm.eu/wp-content/uploads/sites/4/2020/08/ko-black.svg) > [![en](https://weeklyosm.eu/wp-content/uploads/sites/4/2020/09/en-green.svg)](https://translate.google.com/translate?sl=auto&tl=EN&u=https://osm.kr/) server (including publicity for weeklyOSM).

... that the key `floor:material` [is designed](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Key:floor:material) for tagging ceilings (technically the lowest part of a building part with a non-zero `minlevel`). taginfo suggests that it is in fact used for tagging floors, at least in places like [Nepal](https://taginfo.geofabrik.de/asia/nepal/search?q=floor%3Amaterial). It is one of a number of confusing tag names [documented](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Counterintuitive_key_names) on the wiki.

... there is a list of new keys recently [created](http://osm.janmichel.eu/taginfo/newkeys.htm) in OSM? Most of them involve typos or ignorance of established tagging principles. Comes with direct links to correct them.

MarcoR [noted](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/MarcoR/diary/399342) that there are templates (KeyDescription and ValueDescription) in the OSM wiki that are used by taginfo to display some useful information to the user. Since the same information is included in the [data element](https://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Data_items) associated with the feature page, some wiki users in good faith truncate these templates to their minimum (e.g. '{{KeyDescription}}'), preventing [taginfo](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/keys/?key=ref%3Amise#wiki) from retrieving the data.

Following a debate regarding the definition of `service=driveway`, as we [reported](https://weeklyosm.eu/archives/14836#wn581_25514) earlier, an OSM user has proposed a new alternative tagging scheme: [driveway2](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/JaLooooNz/diary/397546) for better routing. Others have [proposed](https://lists.openstreetmap.org/pipermail/talk/2022-September/087734.html) instead  a mass deletion of the [`service=driveaway2`](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/tags/service=driveway2) tag in OSM.

A French weeklyOSM editor at work ... early in the morning ... while skimming the wiki ('for research purposes'), found the key `fetish:office` which led them to wonder how it was used. TagInfo did its job by indicating that `fetish:office` has been [used](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/keys/fetish%3Aoffice#values) only once, at a German [adult bar](https://www.openstreetmap.org/node/491172574), which was last updated 7  years ago.

[taginfo](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/)  is a long-standing OSM project that analyses OpenStreetMap tags. The developer Jochen Topf has [modernised](https://blog.jochentopf.com/2023-04-22-modernizing-taginfo.html) the website's JavaScript and CSS to improve its performance and compatibility with modern web technologies. While the site's appearance and functionality remain largely unchanged, the update paves the way for better support on smaller screens, such as mobile phones. Despite some minor issues introduced during the update, Jochen is satisfied with the current state of the website and plans to focus on content improvements in future iterations.

Jochen Topf, the developer of Taginfo, [describes](https://blog.jochentopf.com/2023-07-15-linking-to-external-tools-from-taginfo.html) the external links he has added to Taginfo's Tags pages with instructions on how to extract / analyze them from external tools (Overpass, OSM Tag History, and ohsome).  ohsome gives the option to select countries to analyze historical OSM data.

Andy Townsend has created a Garmin map style and [explained](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/SomeoneElse/diary/402006) the details in his blog. The tags used are [documented](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/projects/someoneelse_mkgmap_ajt03#tags) in taginfo.
HeiGIT [reported](https://heigit.org/taginfo-goes-ohsome/) that the ohsome dashboard has now been integrated with taginfo.

... CartoCams? It's a [map ](https://cartocams.com) of webcams around the world, based on OpenStreetMap data. You can add more webcam data to OpenStreetMap by using the [contact:webcam](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/keys/?key=contact%3Awebcam#values) tag.

Kamil's eighth OpenStreetMap NextGen development diary [highlighted](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/NorthCrab/diary/404140) faster loading for the notes layer, a new look for location links, taginfo integration for feature icons, and preparations for the project's first development release in early June.
The [OSM Apps Catalog](https://osm-apps.zottelig.ch/) now supports Wikidata and, together with the OSM wiki and taginfo, over 1000 unique apps using OSM data are documented.

... that there is a website that [lists](https://osm.janmichel.eu/taginfo/newkeys.htm) new keys that have recently appeared on OpenStreetMap using data from TagInfo? As of 1 August, the site had identified 92 new keys, none of which have been removed.

Jochen Topf [revealed](https://blog.jochentopf.com/2024-12-09-taginfo-gets-a-new-layout.html) a redesigned layout for [taginfo](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org/), improving the usability of key overview pages. The update introduced fixed-size, responsive boxes that organise information better, including a new 3D values distribution chart, and additional details including wiki page links. The design adapts well to small screens and offers flexibility to display relevant information based on the key or tag.

Jochen Topf gave an [update](https://blog.jochentopf.com/2025-01-08-more-taginfo-news.html) on taginfo, introducing new features such as displaying a tag's status from the OSM wiki on key pages, highlighting inconsistencies, and a report for 'discardable' tags, such as those used by editors like iD and JOSM. Additional improvements include a CSV export option for tables, enhanced tools for wiki maintainers, and an interactive keyboard shortcut guide for experienced users.

[LordGarySugar](https://www.openstreetmap.org/user/LordGarySugar) has created a uMap that [shows](https://umap.openstreetmap.fr/en/map/housename-rarity_1187729#15/51.6970/-0.1896) pins for house names in the United Kingdom coloured by their total occurrence count from [Taginfo GB](https://taginfo.openstreetmap.org.uk/keys/addr:housename#values).
